questions.question: Which of the following is the correct order of adjectives?

options.A: Opinion - Size - Shape - Age - Color - Origin - Material - Purpose
options.B: Size - Opinion - Age - Shape - Color - Material - Origin - Purpose
options.C: Opinion - Age - Shape - Size - Color - Material - Origin - Purpose
options.D: Age - Size - Opinion - Color - Shape - Material - Origin - Purpose

questions.explanation: Adjectives follow the correct order: Opinion, Size, Shape, Age, Color, Origin, Material, Purpose.

questions.question: Which sentence contains an error in adjective usage?

options.A: She wore a beautiful red dress.
options.B: This is the most unique idea I have heard.
options.C: The small brown dog barked loudly.
options.D: He bought an expensive Italian leather jacket.

questions.explanation: 'Unique' is an absolute adjective and does not take 'most' or 'more'.

questions.question: Identify the incorrect sentence:

options.A: He is elder than his brother.
options.B: This is the best pizza I have ever eaten.
options.C: The taller boy won the race.
options.D: She is more intelligent than her sister.

questions.explanation: 'Elder' is not used with 'than'. Instead, use 'older'.

questions.question: Which of the following adjectives is in the correct form?

options.A: She is more cleverer than her brother.
options.B: This book is much interesting than that one.
options.C: That was the most ridiculous excuse I’ve heard.
options.D: The weather today is more colder than yesterday.

questions.explanation: 'Most ridiculous' is correct because 'ridiculous' is a long adjective that takes 'most'.

questions.question: Which of the following adjectives is **NOT** gradable?
questions.explanation: 'Perfect' is an absolute adjective and does not take comparative or superlative forms.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically incorrect?

options.B: This is the most exciting match ever!
options.C: He is the tallest in his class.

questions.explanation: 'More happier' is incorrect; use either 'happier' or 'more happy', not both.

questions.question: Which of the following adjectives is **correctly** used?

options.A: This is the less expensive phone I found.
options.B: She is more kinder than her friend.

questions.explanation: 'Better' is the correct comparative form of 'good'.

questions.question: Which sentence uses **adjectives correctly**?

options.A: This is the most fastest train.
options.B: She has a very best friend.
options.C: This is a truly wonderful experience.
options.D: He is the most intelligentest student in the class.

questions.explanation: 'Truly wonderful' is correct; 'most fastest' and 'intelligentest' are incorrect.

questions.question: Which adjective is used incorrectly?

options.A: This is the worst mistake I have made.
options.B: The weather is more better today.
options.C: This car is cheaper than that one.
options.D: He is the most talented actor.

questions.explanation: 'More better' is incorrect; use either 'better' or 'more good', not both.

questions.question: Which of these sentences is incorrect?

options.A: This cake is sweeter than the one I baked last time.
options.B: She is more taller than her friend.
options.C: That’s the most amazing painting I’ve ever seen.
options.D: This problem is easier to solve.

questions.explanation: 'More taller' is incorrect; use either 'taller' or 'more tall'.

questions.question: Which of the following adjectives is in the correct form?

options.A: This is the most happiest day of my life.
options.B: She is the elder of the two sisters.
options.C: This is the most biggest building in the city.
options.D: He is more faster than his opponent.

questions.explanation: 'Elder' is correct when comparing family members.

questions.question: Which of these adjectives is an absolute adjective?
questions.explanation: 'Dead' is an absolute adjective; it cannot take 'more' or 'very'.

questions.question: Which sentence contains an error in the usage of adjectives?

options.A: This road is narrower than that one.
options.B: She is the most cleverest girl in the class.
options.C: This soup is tastier than the one I made last week.
options.D: This is a more comfortable chair.

questions.explanation: 'Most cleverest' is incorrect; use either 'most clever' or 'cleverest'.

questions.question: Which sentence contains an incorrect comparative adjective?

options.A: This dress is more expensive than the other one.
options.B: The river is more deeper than the lake.
options.C: He is the richest man in town.
options.D: This exam is easier than the last one.

questions.explanation: 'More deeper' is incorrect; use either 'deeper' or 'more deep'.
